instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.5V_S4: What is 5V_S4? This is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S4” – when you see this, assume the person typing it meant to type “PP5V_S4”.

threads.title: 820 4924 liquid damage
threads.message: 820 4924 that had two very small spots of liquid damage in the <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R5689</RESISTOR> area, the rest of the board looks very clean. I have replaced <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1845</CHIP> <CAPACITOR>C1924</CAPACITOR>, <RESISTOR>R5689</RESISTOR>. Those were the only components that looked like they have been affected by the water. I get green light on magsafe, and The First missing line is <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>. All of the Rails before that one are present and correct. <SIGNAL>CPUVSENSE_IN</SIGNAL> appears to be shorted, with a diode measurement of .009v. I'm kind of lost where to go next with this...

threads.title: 820 4924 liquid damage
threads.message: PPVRTC present and 32kHz coming from <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>? Check for power cycling on <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL> with a scope as multimeter may be too slow to catch it.

threads.title: 820 4924 liquid damage
threads.message: 3.325v on PPVRTC, I do not understand what you mean by 32KHz coming from <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, also I do not have a scoop and can not see any power cycle coming from <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 820 4924 liquid damage
threads.message:
Exact value of PPBUS? 3v3 present on L7560? Check all rails for shorts.
Possible crap under the SMC? Crap on J6100?
